ul: iOS applications that use XML documents.

Avoid Using URL Handlers for Sensitive Operations
 Disable Parsing of External XML Entities
 Use Static Format Strings

URL Handlers Are Not Used for Sensitive Operations
 Parsing of External XML Entities Is Disabled
 Static Format Strings Are Used
li: iOS applications that use XML documents.
Identify the XML parsing library used by the application. There are two common libraries for parsing XML in iOS applications: NSXMLParser and LibXML2.

Examine code that uses NSXMLParser. Parsing of external entities is disabled by default in NSXMLParser. Search for the setShouldResolveExternalEntities option to make sure it is not used to enable parsing of external XML entities.

Examine code that uses LibXML2. Parsing of external entitites needs to be manually disabled in LibXML2. Search for the xmlSetExternalEntityLoader method of the parser class to make sure that it is declared in a way that prevents loading of external XML entities.
NSXMLParser. Parsing of external entities is disabled by default in NSXMLParser. Don't explicitly enable parsing of external entities - avoid using the setShouldResolveExternalEntities option.

LibXML2. Parsing of external entitites needs to be manually disabled in LibXML2. To disable parsing of external entities, use the xmlSetExternalEntityLoader method of the parser class to set the external entity loader to a function that doesn't do anything.

links.text: Avoid Using URL Handlers for Sensitive Operations
Disable Parsing of External XML Entities
URL Handlers Are Not Used for Sensitive Operations
Parsing of External XML Entities Is Disabled

html:
Applies To

  • iOS applications that use XML documents.

What to Check For

Verify that parsing of external XML entities is disabled.

Why

Parsing external entities in XML documents may result in XML injection vulnerabilities.

How to Check

To verify that parsing of external XML entities is disabled:

  1. Identify the XML parsing library used by the application. There are two common libraries for parsing XML in iOS applications: NSXMLParser and LibXML2.
  2. Examine code that uses NSXMLParser. Parsing of external entities is disabled by default in NSXMLParser. Search for the setShouldResolveExternalEntities option to make sure it is not used to enable parsing of external XML entities.
  3. Examine code that uses LibXML2. Parsing of external entitites needs to be manually disabled in LibXML2. Search for the xmlSetExternalEntityLoader method of the parser class to make sure that it is declared in a way that prevents loading of external XML entities.

How to Fix

There are two common ways to parse XML in iOS: NSXMLParser and LibXML2.

  1. NSXMLParser. Parsing of external entities is disabled by default in NSXMLParser. Don't explicitly enable parsing of external entities - avoid using the setShouldResolveExternalEntities option.
  2. LibXML2. Parsing of external entitites needs to be manually disabled in LibXML2. To disable parsing of external entities, use the xmlSetExternalEntityLoader method of the parser class to set the external entity loader to a function that doesn't do anything.

Dangerous API Guidelines

  • Avoid Using URL Handlers for Sensitive Operations
  • Disable Parsing of External XML Entities
  • Use Static Format Strings

Dangerous API Checklists

  • URL Handlers Are Not Used for Sensitive Operations
  • Parsing of External XML Entities Is Disabled
  • Static Format Strings Are Used
